input.label: Phone number of the respondent
input.hint: Please provide the phone number of the respondent (eg. 256779618452)

select1.label: Name of enumerator

input.label: I am [name of interviewer] and I am from an NGO called [TTC], and we are conducting a research project in your locality. The purpose of this project is to measure people’s knowledge, attitudes about, and practices regarding solar light.

This survey will take about 20 minutes. Participation in this survey is completely voluntary, and you may stop giving information at any point in time. If you accept to complete this survey, your answers will be used to get a better understanding of the use of and need for solar energy in your locality.

All information that you provide is completely confidential and will be used only for research purposes. We will NOT share this information with any other organization. If you complete the survey, we will thank you with 1,000 UGX of airtime.

select1.label: Do you agree to participate in this survey?
Are you either the head of the household, or the spouse of the head of the household?
Do you give permission to be contacted more often to participate in similar surveys?
1.1 Language of interview
1.2 Respondent's home location

item.label: Nwoya -> Nwoya County -> Anaka Town Council

input.label: 1.3a Given name
1.3b Family name

input.label: Now I would like to ask you some more questions about yourself and your household.
2.1a What is the given name of the head of your household?
2.1a What is the family name of the head of your household?

select1.label: 2.1b What is the relationship of the head of the household to you?

input.label: 2.2a How many people live in your household on a permanent basis?
2.2b How many children under 16 years of age live in your household on a permanent basis?

select1.label: 2.3 What is your gender?

input.label: 2.4 How old are you?

select1.label: 2.5 What is your highest education level achieved?
2.6 What is your marital status?

input.label: 2.6 Please specify 'other'

select1.label: 2.7 What is your occupation?

input.label: 2.7 Please specify 'other'
2.8 What is your household's average monthly income?

select.label: 2.9 During the last 12 months, what were the sources of your household income?

item.label: Money from other HH members' jobs / work
Interest on savings / rent on assets
Remittances / money from family or friends outside HH

input.label: 2.9 Please specify 'other'

select1.label: 2.10 Within your household, who decides on household expenditure?

input.label: Now I would like to ask you some questions about your access to electricity

select1.label: 3.1 Is your household currently connected to the main power grid (UMEME)?

input.label: 3.2 How much do you pay for electricity each month?

select1.label: 3.3 How often do you experience power cuts?
3.4a Do you currently have any electrical appliances in your household?

input.label: Now I would like to ask you some questions about how you light your home

select1.label: 4.1a What do you usually use to light your home at night?

item.label: Laput (or tadooba; locally made paraffin lamp)
Tara; lantern with glass cover using paraffn / kerosene
Nothing - my home is usually not lit at night

input.label: 4.1a Please specify 'other'

select1.label: 4.1b Why doesn't your household use a light during the night?

item.label: We do not need a light
We do not own a light
Our light does not have fuel

select1.label: 4.2 What is your source of light at night when you experience power cuts?

item.label: Laput (or tadooba; locally made paraffin lamp)
Tara; lantern with glass cover using paraffn / kerosene
Nothing - my home is usually not at night

input.label: 4.2 Please specify
4.3 How many hours do you usually use the [primary light source] to light your home each night?
4.4 How many [primary light source] do you use each night?
4.5a How much did you pay for the laput / tara when you last purchased it?

select1.label: 4.5b How often do you have to replace the laput / tara?

input.label: 4.6a How much kerosene or paraffin, in liters, do you use each month?
4.6b How much do you spend on kerosene / paraffin each month?

select1.label: 4.7 How far from your home is the place where you purchase kerosene or paraffin?

input.label: 4.8a How much does it cost you to travel to and from this place?
4.8b How many times every month do you or someone in your household make this trip?
4.9 How much do you spend on candles / wood bundles each month?

select1.label: 4.10 How far from your home is the place where you purchase (or collect) the candles or wood bundles?

input.label: 4.11a How much does it cost you to travel to and from this place?
4.11b How many times every month do you or someone in your household make this trip?
4.12 How much did you pay for the [solar lamp / panel / torch / lantern / other] when you last purchased it?
Now I would like to ask you some questions about your opinion of how well lit your home is.

select1.label: 5.1a On a typical night when lighting your home with the [primary light source], do you feel your home is sufficiently lit?

select.label: 5.1b You consider your home insufficiently lit because...
select.hint: Read options, check all that apply

item.label: Some rooms that needed light did not have light
In rooms that had light, the light was not bright enough
The lights were not on / lit for long enough

input.label: 5.1b Please specify 'other'
Now I would like to ask you some questions about the mobile phone(s) in your household.
6.1 How many mobile phones does your household currently own?
6.2 For one phone, how many times do you have to charge each week?

select1.label: 6.3 What is the primary way these mobile phones are charged?

item.label: Friend or family home, mains or generator
Friend or family home, solar panel
Friend or family home, solar lamp

input.label: 6.4 How much does it cost for one charge at the charging station?
Now I would like to ask you some questions about devices used by your household that use batteries

select1.label: 7.1a Does your household currently use any devices that are powered by or use battery?
7.1b What device is this?

input.label: Please specify
7.2 How many batteries does this device use?
7.3 How many times in one month do you have to replace the batteries of this device?
7.4 How much is spent on batteries each month for this device?
You can add more devices by clicking the '+'
Now I would like to ask you some questions about solar lamps.

select1.label: 8.1 Are you familiar with (know of, have heard of) solar lamps/lanterns?
8.2 Do you or anyone in your household own a solar lamp / lantern?
8.3a Do you know where you can purchase a solar lamp / lantern?
8.3b How far is your home from the place where you purchase a solar lamp / lantern?

input.label: 8.4 How much does it cost to purchase a solar lamp at this place?

select1.label: 8.5a Are you interested in purchasing a solar lamp sometime in the future?
select1.hint: Or another device if you already own one

select1.label: 8.5b Why not?

item.label: I do not need a solar lamp
The lighting devices I am using are good
I don't know the products well enough
The product is not good quality
I already have a solar lamp

input.label: 8.5b Please specify other
8.6 How much would you spend / are you comfortable to pay for a solar lamp / lantern?

select1.label: 8.7 What would be your preferable payment method?

select.label: 8.8 What about solar lamps (what features) makes you want to purchase the device?

item.label: Once changed, can be used for a long time
Can use in variety of positions (on table, hanging, etc)
Better for health than other types of light
Will help households to do things at night
Can be used to charge mobile phones
Can be used to power electrical applicanes

input.label: 8.8 Please specify other

select.label: 8.9 If you purchased a solar lamp, what would you or members of your household use it for?

input.label: 8.9 Please specify other
8.10 Please indicate if you agree or disagree with these statements about solar lamps

select1.label: 8.10a Solar lamps save money
8.10b Solar lamps are affordable to purchase
8.10c Solar lamps give off a bright light
8.10d Solar lamps are able to light a large area
8.10e Solar lamps are easy to use
8.10f Solar lamps are easy to repair if they break
8.10g Solar lamps are durable (they don't break easily)
8.10h Solar lamps charge quickly
8.10i When fully charged, solar lamps can be used for a long time before they need to be recharged
8.10j Solar lamps are better for your health than other types of lamps or light sources
8.10k Solar lamps are good for the environment

input.label: Thank you for your time
